newsitem.title: FRANCE: CLF-Groupe Dexia reports good start to 97.
newsitem.headline: CLF-Groupe Dexia reports good start to 97.

text.p: Credit Local de France-Groupe Dexia, the French arm of Franco-Belgian banking group Dexia, had an "excellent start to the year, its chairman Pierre Richard said on Tuesday.
CLF-Groupe Dexia said it had registered 29.75 billion francs in new local authority financing in the first four months of 1997, a rise of more than 40 percent from the same period the previous year.

"We are on track to achieving more than 80 billion francs in new credits between now and the end of the year. Including the activity of Credit Communal de Belgique, this will more likely be a figure of 100 billion francs," he told a news conference.
He said, without giving details, that the group's profits should grow in 1997. In 1996, the group had a combined profit of 3.2 billion francs, up 10.38 percent.
CLF-Dexia France, which is changing its name to Dexia-France, proposed a net dividend of 15.70 francs per share for 1996, up 13 percent on 1995.
